title: False Friends
opening: A droll merchant named Merlinus now joins Eliwood's group. With Merlinus in tow, they set out for Laus the following day. Laus is located in the heart of Lycia, a territory ruled by the power-hungry marquess of Laus, Lord Darin. Preparations for the war of which the Pheraen magistrate spoke...The disappearance of Eliwood's father, Elbert...The death of Marquess Santaruz...Do these all revolve around Lord Darin? In Eliwood's heart, the need for truth is drowned in fear...A fear of what that truth may hold.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: Are you certain? Pherae’s heir is here?

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Yes, Father. We’ve just received word from our lookouts. He’s still beyond that hill, but he’ll be here before long.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: Lord Ephidel, what is the meaning of this?

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: Perhaps when they reached Santaruz Castle, Lord Helman was still clinging to life.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: You can’t be serious!

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: He couldn’t have lasted too long, but…maybe he told them something.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: That’s terrible! Our plan! It’s all for naught, isn’t it?

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: No need to be so alarmed, my lord. Even if he told young Eliwood something of our schemes, Pherae no longer has any power. All Eliwood could do is perhaps inform Marquess Ostia.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: Ostia?! That would be ruinous! Lord Uther may be young and new to the throne, but he’s dangerous. That addlepated Helman! He was a coward to the end! To betray us now, when we’re so close…We only need a little more time to complete our plans for rebellion!

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: Then before Marquess Ostia becomes aware of any of this, you would do well to stop them here.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: Yes, you’re right, of course. We do have a chance! They have to pass through Laus to get to Ostia. We can still silence them!

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: They must not pass. No matter the cost.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: Let us make haste. Call up our finest troops.

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Father! Please, let me take the command.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: Erik! Tell me, Son, can you succeed?

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: That clod Eliwood and I studied together in Ostia. He’s a trusting fool. If he sees me, he’ll lower his guard. And when he does, we strike!

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Ephidel
intro.line: I beg your pardon… Is this not too much for him? If, by strange chance, he fell, things could turn for the worse.

intro.speaker: Darin
intro.line: No, I know I’m the lad’s father, but Erik’s quite clever, I tell you. Snuffing Pherae’s whelp will be no trouble at all. It’s settled! It’s up to you now, Erik. Bring me the head of Pherae’s darling son!

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Yes, Father! I will not fail you!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Look around… They truly are preparing for battle. Marquess Laus! What is he scheming?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You don’t much look like you want to go to the castle.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: If we go and learn the truth, we may have to go to war.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: That’s fine with me!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I… I’ve no love for war. If I concentrate on the foe before me, I’m fine. If I picture families, innocents caught up in our foolish politics? If I imagine them… All I can do is pray for a way to solve things peacefully.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Eliwood….

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Lord Eliwood! A knight has ridden forth from the castle.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: A lone knight?

intro.speaker: Marcus
intro.line: Yes, my lord. Our scouts say it’s Marquess Laus’s son, Erik. He is asking to see you.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Erik?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Gah. Why did it have to be that buffoon?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I will see him. Bring him here.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: I’m leaving. I never could abide him. I’ll go for a ride and survey our surroundings.

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Good day, Lord Hector. Is Lord Eliwood with you?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: No. He's treating with Marquess Laus's son, Erik.

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Is it wise for you to be away at this time?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Erik's a contemptuous peacock. He's intolerable. And he made a show of riding from the castle alone. Something feels odd.

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: That is unusual. I've been thinking, my lord... Laus is blessed with clear water and fertile ground. See the shade its tall trees and grasses cast? Ideal for hiding soldiers, don't you think?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: You're right, Oswin. I'm going to take a look around.

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Very good. Let's split up and double our ground. One thing, my lord!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: What is it?

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Do not let yourself be distracted. Keep your guard up.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Ha ha ha. Yes, Mother. I will.

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Hello! It’s been a long time, Eliwood!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Erik… What is your business?

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: My business? What do you mean? I heard my old friend was here in Laus. I merely thought I’d ride out to greet you!

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: So tell me, friend, what brings you to Laus? Are you…on your way to Ostia?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hm? Why would you think that?

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Well, you were always such good friends with Hector. He and I never… got along very well. For a noble, his behavior was crude, and his manner of speech… You would have thought him a peasant at first glance. You’re still friends with Hector, aren’t you? When did you see him last? How do you communicate?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Erik… You’re after something. What is it?

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Pardon?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Everywhere I look, Laus prepares for battle. What are you and your father planning? I will know the truth!

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Hm… I’d hoped to wait until you’d told me of Ostia. Of whether you’ve spoken with the marquess or not.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: What are you talking about?

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Hm heh heh… Eliwood, I have always despised you. How I’ve longed to smash you and your pathetic morality into pieces! I’ve dreamed of this day, and here it is at last!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Too bad you’ll not live to see the end of it.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hector!

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Y-You! Hector! You couldn’t… Have you spoken with Ostia already?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Maybe we have, maybe we haven’t. Eliwood, this mongrel has troops lying in ambush all around us. Laus regulars, every one. We’re in for a rough time.

intro.speaker: Erik
intro.line: Heh heh… There’s little point in fighting. You’re trapped! My forces will overwhelm you, an unending torrent of soldiers! Laus’s elite knights are at the ready as well. Heh heh… How long do you think you can survive?

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Craven cur!

intro.speaker: Hannah
intro.line: Hee hee hee... A world of trouble you've landed yourself in, yes?

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Who--!? You startled me, old woman! You should get out of here. This is going to be a bad place to stay if you plan on living.

intro.speaker: Hannah
intro.line: I want to see the one searching for his father. Marquess Pherae's son.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Listen up, old woman! You're close to death as it is! Quit your yammering and move on!

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Hector! You should mind your manners. I am Eliwood. May I ask your name, milady?

intro.speaker: Hannah
intro.line: Ho ho ho. What a polite young man. I'm Hannah, a fortune-teller. I came here to help you.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Can you tell me where my father's gone?

intro.speaker: Hannah
intro.line: No...but... I can see other things...useful things... I can tell you what weapons to take into battle, as well as who should wield them. Things of that nature.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I see...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Don't tell me you believe any of this.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: I have no reason to believe or disbelieve in Hannah's powers. But I'll not rule out anything if it helps me find my father.

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: Lord Eliwood! Lord Hector! I make my living as a humble merchant. If you have any items you no longer need, please let poor Merlinus take them.

battle.speaker: Hannah
battle.line: Heh heh heh. I'm here, too. Speak to me for auguries before you engage the enemy. My services are not free, but they may save you from paying a greater price!

battle.speaker: Serra
battle.line: Uh-oh! I think we've been surrounded! Uh... but I'm not worried a bit. I'm with you after all, Mark. We make quite a team. Right. Come on, Mark! Let's get started!

battle.speaker: Merlinus
battle.line: Lord Eliwood, shall I join you? If you deploy my tent, I can help with equipment. I can switch items for you and hold them if your packs are full. However, my tent cannot be moved about, so if you deploy it, it will require a guard. I beg your understanding.

battle.speaker: Tutorial
battle.line: Merlinus’s merchant tent can be deployed on this map. If you deploy the tent, any items you cannot carry can be sent to the tent. However, the tent is vulnerable to enemy attack. If the tent loses all its HP, it will vanish from the map and remain unavailable until the next map. Merlinus’s tent gains one level for every battle it survives. The tent will be harder to destroy as it increases in level.

battle.speaker: Marcus
battle.line: Mark! Let me take the point. There may be many of them, but numbers are meaningless! We are knights of Pherae. These mice of Laus will never defeat us!

battle.speaker: Erk
battle.line: Hm. We certainly could stand some assistance…

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: I’m sorry, but it’s just not possible. If we disobey Marquess Laus, who knows what might happen to us?

battle.speaker: Erk
battle.line: I understand. We’ll seek our aid elsewhere.

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: You’ll find the same answer everywhere you go. Eventually, you’ll have to do as the marquess orders. You would do well to tell your employer the same thing.

battle.speaker: Erk
battle.line: Hm. Good day to you.

battle.speaker: Bandit
battle.line: Eh? What’s all this? Looks like a war’s broken out. Aha ha ha! Perfect! Time for a raid! Up and at ’em, mates! That village is ripe for plunder!

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: Priscilla. Has your escort returned yet?

battle.speaker: Priscilla
battle.line: No. He left yesterday in search of a way out of here… I just hope the soldiers of Laus haven’t captured him.

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: His search for help must have been fruitless. Marquess Laus has ordered that no aid be given to you. There’s really nothing that any of us can do. I apologize, but…

battle.speaker: Priscilla
battle.line: No, no. You could turn me over to the marquess, and yet you continue to grant me asylum. I’m grateful for that. Of course, if I simply went to the castle, this would all be over.

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: Don’t fret over that. None of us are overly fond of the marquess. He’s always threatening us. He treats us like slaves. All of these war preparations? We want nothing to do with them. We may be divided into territories, but we’re Lycians one and all. We may be invaded by another country one day, but why does he want to start a war here at home? None of us understand what he is doing.

battle.speaker: Erik
battle.line: Blast! They’re stronger than I had supposed! To the castle! I want all the reinforcements available, and I want them now!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Lord Erik is struggling! He requests reinforcements!

battle.speaker: Darin
battle.line: What? Ready the men.

battle.speaker: Ephidel
battle.line: Unbelievable… These numbers cannot stop them.

battle.speaker: Darin
battle.line: Ephidel? W-Where are you going?

battle.speaker: Ephidel
battle.line: It seems that conquering Lycia might have been too much to ask of you after all. I must inform my master. The Black Fang will be leaving at once.

battle.speaker: Darin
battle.line: No! You… You can’t abandon us! Not at this stage!

battle.speaker: Ephidel
battle.line: Who was it that said Ostia mustn’t learn of our plans? Wasn’t it you, Lord Darin? The marquess of Laus himself?

battle.speaker: Darin
battle.line: Y-Yes, it was. There’s no turning back for me. Not now! P-P-Please! One more… Give me one more chance. I assure you, I will not disappoint Lord Nergal!

battle.speaker: Ephidel
battle.line: Very well… Assemble your men. We will regroup elsewhere.

battle.speaker: Darin
battle.line: Eh? You can’t mean… My son…my home… Am I to abandon them?

battle.speaker: Ephidel
battle.line: Would you fall in disgrace along with your son? Our master, Lord Nergal, is offering you the throne of all Lycia…Surely a few sacrifices are not too much to ask?

battle.speaker: Darin
battle.line: Yes… You’re right. My destiny is greater than this. I was born to be king of Lycia.

battle.speaker: Ephidel
battle.line: And as for an heir? You’re still young, my lord. You will have time. You must not let a moment’s sentimentality cloud your judgment.

battle.speaker: Erik
battle.line: Where are my reinforcements? Why haven’t they come? I’ve no choice. I must attack! You! To the castle! Find more men!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes, my lord!

recruit-talk.speaker: Serra
recruit-talk.line: Ohmigosh! It’s Erk! It’s been SO long! What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erk
recruit-talk.line: Oh… Serra. You’re the last person I wanted to see…

recruit-talk.speaker: Serra:
recruit-talk.line: Oh, that’s so sweet! You wanted to see me again!

recruit-talk.speaker: Serra
recruit-talk.line: Hey, I know! This is perfect. Come with us and lend a hand, Erk.

recruit-talk.speaker: Serra
recruit-talk.line: Come on! I’ll even introduce you to Lords Hector and Eliwood! I know you. You’re probably just wandering about without work.

recruit-talk.speaker: Erk
recruit-talk.line: No, Serra. I’m afraid I am gainfully employed. However… If you’re fighting Laus… This might work out after all.

recruit-talk.speaker: Serra
recruit-talk.line: What are you babbling about? Make up your mind, will you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erk
recruit-talk.line: My employer is hiding in a village south of here. If you’ll help me protect her, I’ll join up with you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Erk
recruit-talk.line: Lady Priscilla! I’m glad to see you well.

recruit-talk.speaker: Priscilla
recruit-talk.line: Erk! Have you joined Lord Eliwood’s company as well?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erk
recruit-talk.line: Yes. Traveling with them seems to be the safest way for us to continue your search for your family.

recruit-talk.speaker: Erk
recruit-talk.line: Oh, my apologies. This isn’t the place to discuss such things.

recruit-talk.speaker: Erk
recruit-talk.line: Lady Priscilla, my teacher entrusted you to my care. Until you have reached your goal, I will not leave your side.

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: You’re battling Erik and his men, right? Let me tell you, I’m on your side! My granddaughter… Marquess Laus took her away. He found her pretty, and forced her to the castle. It’s not much, but please take this. It’s a large sword, so you have to be strong to use it. It’s a bit unwieldy, but it is a mighty weapon nonetheless. I hope you can defeat the marquess’s son, Erik. It would make our lives more pleasant. Good luck to you.

recruit-visit.speaker: Priscilla
recruit-visit.line: Again? Are you another messenger from the marquess? Please, do not waste your time. I will not change my decision. Pardon? Marquess Laus did not send you? I… I beg your forgiveness. It was my mistake. Say… If it’s not too much trouble, might I leave with you? I’m on a journey. Marquess Laus is barring my way, and…I’m trapped. I am trained in the use of staves. Please, help me.

recruit-visit.speaker: Priscilla
recruit-visit.line: I should be asking you that, Erk. Have you been wounded?

recruit-visit.speaker: Erk
recruit-visit.line: I’m fine. Listen, my lady. I’ve found some friends who will help us.

recruit-visit.speaker: Erk
recruit-visit.line: We’ll be joining up with Marquess Pherae’s son. Traveling with them seems to be the safest way for us to continue your search for your family.

recruit-visit.speaker: Erk
recruit-visit.line: Oh, my apologies. This isn’t the place to discuss such things.

recruit-visit.speaker: Erk
recruit-visit.line: Lady Priscilla, my teacher entrusted you to my care. Until you have reached your goal, I will not leave your side.

boss.speaker: Erik
boss.line: Laus is the true throne of Lycia! Taste my lance!

boss.speaker: Erik
boss.line: I am no one’s prisoner! Unhand me! Gwaaa!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Come on, Erik! Get up!

end.speaker: Erik
end.line: You… You peasants… You can’t treat a proper noble like this!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: It’s too late for niceties! Be thankful you’re still breathing!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Erik, you must tell me. Where is your father? We’ve searched the entire castle, and there’s no one here.

end.speaker: Erik
end.line: D-Don’t be ridiculous! My father would not abandon… No! He’d never… Ephidel…

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Ephidel? Who’s that?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Speak, cur!! Do you want to die here?

end.speaker: Erik
end.line: Ah!

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector! Erik…please. You must tell us everything you know. I… I just want to know where my father is.

end.speaker: Erik
end.line: ………Ephidel… He appeared at the castle one year ago. He came…and my father changed. Ostia’s position had always bothered my father… He felt Laus deserved to rule all of Lycia. But he’d never gone so far as to speak of rebellion.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Did you say…rebellion?

end.speaker: Erik
end.line: Ephidel had something… With it, he convinced my father to set this plan in motion. My father then sent envoys to several other marquesses. Marquess Pherae, he had approved of the idea.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Never! My father would never agree to such a thing!

end.speaker: Erik
end.line: Believe or disbelieve. That is your choice. First was Marquess Santaruz. Then Marquess Pherae’s reply arrived. Marquess Pherae visited here six months ago to seal his approval.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: That’s not… possible…

end.speaker: Erik
end.line: My father and yours argued vehemently that day. Marquess Pherae always distrusted Ephidel. He tried to convince my father to send Ephidel and the Black Fang assassins out of Lycia. My father would not be persuaded, and Marquess Pherae left the castle. As you know, he then disappeared. I doubt he’s still alive.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: No!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Shut your mouth!

end.speaker: Erik
end.line: Eliwood said he wanted to hear everything. My father… He is but Ephidel’s puppet. He’ll listen to anything that villain says. Even watch his own son…die…… Those are the sort of people you’re dealing with. Marquess Pherae betrayed them. They would not let him live! Ha ha…ha ha ha ha ha ha…

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Ah…

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Wait! Eliwood!

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Lord Hector.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oswin! Did Eliwood pass this way?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Lord Eliwood? He ran through that gate and went outside.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I see.

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Lord Hector! A moment, please.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What is it, Oswin.

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Let us return to Ostia. The rumors... I've heard that... Lord Hector, I cannot approve of helping Eliwood...or Pherae...any longer.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What are you saying?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: We must think of Ostia's well-being. If Marquess Pherae was involved in a rebellion--

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oswin. You will take back those words.

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Lord Hector, I appreciate your feelings...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I know Eliwood's father very well. I'm telling you that he is a man worthy of our trust. You are in my service! Do you not feel you should follow my orders?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Heed my words, Oswin. You are my brother's vassal. Your duties to guard me come second to this. Return to Ostia, Oswin. You've done your duty. ........Thank you.

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: .......My remarks about Marquess Pherae were improper. I apologize completely.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oswin? Stop! That's enough! You need not bend your knee to me!

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: My lord, I would swear my service to you.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Service...to me?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Please accept my lance as your own. Then return it with your blessings.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oswin, you--

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: I am a knight in service to Castle Ostia. Until now, I have only offered my lance to Lord Uther. Yet... I now wish to offer you that same service. Please grant me that honor.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Oswin...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Eliwood…

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: My father is alive… And… I cannot believe he supports…rebellion. There must be… There has to be a reason…

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I know. I don’t believe any of this for an instant. My brother trusted Marquess Pherae more than anyone. First, we’ll find your father and uncover the truth. We’ll talk to my brother after that.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector, I’m sorry…

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Don’t look like that. Your father is surely alive. Right?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Yes, of course… Marquess Laus… Black Fang assassins… Now this mysterious Ephidel… I’ll find them all and prove my father’s innocence!
